comment.author: 61364329@N03
comment._content: I'm doubtful there were Sea Scouts in 1910, and there is no scouting insignia.  Sailor suits were common garb for boys.  I think it is a grouping of six sets of twins, three identical, three fraternal.  The identicals are the two seated on the right, the two with sailor collars trimmed with stripes and short hair: and the two either side of the boy in the middle.   The non-identicals are the two at the back with Eton collars, the two seated on the left, and the other more mis-matched pair - a large boy standing back left, and a small boy seated on the high stand in a velvet suit.

comment.author: 61364329@N03
comment._content: I'd be inclined to retitle this photo "Early Twin Study".
